headline: CNN Newsroom
subHeadline: Alex Murdaugh Cross-Examined for Second Day in His Murder Trial. Aired 3-3:30p ET

utterances.speaker: CREIGHTON WATERS, PROSECUTOR
utterances.sentences: Correction, by 12(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: ALEX MURDAUGH, MURDER DEFENDANT
utterances.sentences: ... him. He doesn't like go to doctors, making him go get his blood pressure checked. His feet is swollen up recently.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Well ...

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: So that was - there was a big huge deal.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: What's that.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: We hung around the house for a little while. I know that Maggie went to the kennels. I don't know exactly where Paul went, but he left the house too.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Okay. How did Maggie get down to the kennels.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't know exactly. But on normal occasion, she would drive a buggy, drive a four wheeler or very common for her to walk.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Okay. How about Paul? Where's ...

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: But it, I mean, it could be anyway, you know?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Okay.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't know exactly. I wish I could help you with that.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: So they left and went down to the kennels?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Well Maggie went to go to the kennels.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Okay. Paul - and Paul left.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: And I'm assuming Paul left ...

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Okay.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: ... because of ... UNIDENTIFIED MALE

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: ... what happened. I mean, I'm assuming ...

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: ... Paul went to the kennels.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Okay. And what did you do once Maggie and Paul left?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I stayed in the house ...

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Okay.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: ... and I was watching TV looking at my phone and I actually fell asleep on the couch.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Okay. And what time did you wake up?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't know exactly what time I woke up, but when you all get my phone - I think one of the first things I did when I got up was called Maggie ...

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Mm-hm.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: ... because I was going to my mom's.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Mm-hm.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: And I know I texted her because I checked my phone. And what time we say the text was, Jim, like 9

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I didn't see that. I got it written down for (inaudible) ...

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I showed you the other night (inaudible) ...

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir. I got it.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: So I texted her. So I called her just before that.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Mm-hm.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: And I mean, she didn't answer at that point and I left to go to my mom's.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Okay.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: You all just have to look - I don't - I'm not sure if I called Paul or not.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Well, and that's why we're getting the phone so we can nail down the times ...

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Right. UNIDENTIFIED MALE(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Pretty much all of that was lies, wasn't it?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: The part about me not being at the kennel was a lie.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Well also not knowing that Paul went down there, not being sure, that was a lie too, wasn't it? I mean, you're putting some detail on this thing, aren't you?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No. Not knowing when Paul left - everything about me not going to the kennel was a lie.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: And you're able to just do that so easily and so convincingly and so naturally, don't you?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Really, that's not for me to judge.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: That's true.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: It's an odd story.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: (Inaudible) where I'm going.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: ... feel right now.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: So do you all have any good clues?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: So we're trying to put a rush on that to get an answer quick. And hoping that's going to tell us something.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: By evidence, I mean, is it things you think are going to be helpful?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Well, I mean, like the shot shells out there, the casings, the DNA swabs that we took from the door handle to see if anybody touched the door handles, any other places that we think somebody may have touched while they were out there, we're trying to collect DNA from that and analyze that. Which at the conclusion of this what I'm going to also ask is that we get buccal swab, the DNA swab from you.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No problem.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Your DNA is going to be there, but we need to eliminate it once it's developed, so ...

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We don't need that unknown ... UNIDENTIFIED MALE

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: ... when it actually is a family member (inaudible) ...

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No problem.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: First you've done this.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I want to tell you one thing while I'm thinking about it.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Paul was really an incredibly intuitive little dude.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Mm-hm.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: And I mean, he was like a little detective and ...(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: He was like little detective, was that what you said?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: It is what I said. And he was very intuitive like I said.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: And that was what Marian described as Maggie's term for how he was and keeping tabs on your pill usage, wasn't that correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: That was what Maggie said about him.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: For some reason you decided to bring that up in this interview, did you?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: The - I mean that was a - I mean, it was a trait or Paul's personality. I mean, I think anybody who knew him would tell you how intuitive he was.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: (Inaudible) coming through hours of videos that we've ...(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. For the record, I'm at 46(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: ... gone out and collected.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Well, thank you all ...

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: ... very much.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: So Mr. Alex ...

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: You don't have to call me mister (inaudible) ...

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: (Inaudible) ...

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: ... I thank you for that (inaudible) ...

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: When you and Paul got back to the house, Ms. Maggie's there and you all ate supper, which has been prepared. And you - said you laid down and took a little nap. And when you got up, Maggie and Paul was gone or did they leave when you laid down?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I believed that - I'm not sure.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: But they weren't there when you woke up around the nine o'clock mark or so when you made the call to Maggie to let her know you're (inaudible) ...

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No. Nobody was in that house when I left.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: So, I'm just trying to narrow - the last time that Paul and - you saw Paul at Maggie when you were all eating supper.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Okay.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Your answer was yes sir, is that correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: That's correct.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: I'm about to go to the August 2021 interview, but between that June 10th interview and the August interview, you were not working very much, is that correct if at all?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, I definitely wasn't working very much. I think I was working a little bit. But no, not very much at all.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Did you go to Johnny Parker to borrow $250,000 in order to cover the Ferris fees?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I did.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You did?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I did.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Did you tell him what that was for? MURDAUGH

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I did.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: And did you get those fees before you sign any paperwork or documentation?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I've heard testimony about that in this case, but I can't tell you the specifics of that.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Okay. You don't recall that?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Do I recall when I signed paperwork?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Mm-hm.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, sir.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You don't recall that you got the money a month before you had to sign the paperwork?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, sir, I don't recall that.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: (Inaudible) ...

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I'm not disputing that, but I don't recall it.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Did you go to your best friend, Chris Wilson, and convince him to cover $192,000, the remaining $190,000 in order for him to send that email to your law firm as if those fees had been there all along?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I spoke to Chris Wilson and did not have the full amount of the fees. And I got Chris Wilson to put the remaining fees in his trust account.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: And when you did that, you didn't tell him the truth about your life. You just asked him to cover you, correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, I didn't - I did not tell him.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: And he agreed to do that because of his belief of who you really were or who he thought you were.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: He agreed to do that for whatever reasons. I assume that was a big part of it.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: And once that $600,000 was transferred, Chris Wilson sent an email to you saying those fees had been there - were in his trust account, correct? MURDAUGH

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: And then you forwarded that email to Lee Cope and Jeanne Seckinger, correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I know I forwarded to Jeanne and I've heard that testimony about forwarding it to Lee Cope, so I believe that's correct.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Okay.(Inaudible) from PSB?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Because at that time, there were limitations on how much I could borrow, because Mags was passed and so I was limited.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Okay.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I couldn't get a loan against Moselle and had to get a loan against Palmetto State - I mean against Edisto.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Going to the third interview.All right, I'm going to go to 17:45. Bear with me. We're having some technical difficulties. Jury's seen this, so - I mean, again, you're repeating the same lies over and over again.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I did.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Effortlessly and convincingly.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't know about that.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Well, they can see it there.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Agree with that?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Nobody yelled at you.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Nobody yelled at me. Nobody - none of these guys were ever discourteous to me like ...

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Nobody what?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I said none of those guys are ever discourteous to me. You made a comment earlier that David Owens was mean or something about being mean and he was never mean to me.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. But you decided to lie in part because you distrusted David Owen.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I distrust the SLED in general.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Mm-hm. MURDAUGH

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Who turned out not to be David Owen.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: So - wait a minute, I want to be clear, you're saying now you thought that this was the - some David Owen that had something to do with Greg Alexander 10 years ago?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, sir. And I'm not saying that now, I said that all along.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Mm-hm.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: The person that I saw and watched in Greg Alexander's trial that was clear to me was - just - it was terrible what they did to Greg Alexander. And the person at SLED who was responsible for that was a guy named David.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Mm-hm.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: All right? And I'm not going to get into his last name. I thought that David Owens that night was that guy. Later down the road and it was a while, I checked into that and I found out that I was mistaken that it was not David Owen, it was a different David.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: So when we went back and we spent a lot of time going through that first statement, you're telling me now that you were sitting there thinking that this was a completely different guy the whole time and that was on your mind during that entire interview?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Yes, at the time ...

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Okay. All right.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: ... I thought that David Owen - no, I didn't think David Owen was a different person. I thought that David Owens was the person that my dad and I had watched.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Mm-hm.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Just - and my dad and I truly thought evidence was manufactured.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Okay. You said that part.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: And ...

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You said that part.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: ... and I thought it was David Owen.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Mm-hm. MURDAUGH

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Okay.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: But that's what I thought that night.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Any other factors or details you want to add about your decision (inaudible) ...

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I want to answer any question you have, Mr. Waters.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: No, no, I mean, let's - any more?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Do you have any more questions?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: No. I mean any more about your decision to lie? I mean, I just want to - let's get it all out now. Okay.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: If you have any questions, I'll be glad to answer.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Well, I do.Tell him about the replacement Blackout. You initially told law enforcement that you weren't sure whether or not there was one, correct? Correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Oh, no, sir. You're absolutely wrong about that.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: What did you say that?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Shortly after this, it became being told that Paul's gun had been stolen.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Mm-hm.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: And the one you heard talk about being stolen from the thing and I'm not sure how I learned this, but I learned that somebody - I believe SLED had gone to John Bedingfield who made those guns and can only find paperwork for two Blackouts. One of which they were saying was stolen '17 and that's what they were telling me. And I was certain and told them that I was certain that there was a third one.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: But initially in June 8th and June 10th or June 10th, you were saying that - you thought that John (ph) replaced it and then you kind of wavered and then eventually said you did replace it, correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't believe that's correct. No, sir.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You don't believe that's correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, I don't believe that's correct.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Did you say to law enforcement that you thought that this third guy, and the replacement Blackout had gone missing in Christmas of 2020.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: The - it did go missing in Christmas 2020.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: So you're telling them that one also had been missing six months prior, correct? Wait, answer my question first and then you can explain. Did you all - tell law enforcement that that gun had been missing since Christmas time?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I told law enforcement that when we looked for it at Christmas time, we could not find it.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Okay.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: And that was accurate. We looked for it when we were trying to shoot hogs, when we had a group of people out there and we could not find it.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Okay. But you now know that it was there as late as turkey season.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I - no, sir. I know that Will Loving and PawPaw had it right before turkey season like Will Loving testified to.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Okay. So it was around actually.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: It was around there at some point in time there, yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. So you're saying it got stolen a second time or you just don't know?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, I'm not ...

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: The 12-year-old stole it the second time?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I never said the 12-year-old stole any gun, Mr. Waters.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Sorry, the five-two people stole it the second time?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't know that it was stolen, I just know that when we look forward to Christmas time, we couldn't find it. And I know this, I know that I hadn't seen that gun in a long time.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Mm-hm.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: And, of course, it didn't see it there because it's got to be missing, correct, Mr. Murdaugh?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Ask that question again.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: (Inaudible) circumstance for your latest story to work is that it's got to be missing as well. It was - when you told law enforcement it was missing at Christmas time, now we've had a testimony at this trial and now you're still claiming that you never saw it. It must have been kept somewhere else. Where else would it have been kept?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: It could have been get anywhere. Mr. Waters, the way Paul did guns, the way guns were handled around there. I was terrible about that.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You're terrible about that.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I should have been stricter.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: But you know that that third gun was fired right outside the gun room door in turkey season of 2021, correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I know that now based on what Will Loving said.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: And you know it was also fired across the street at your shooting house around that same time, don't you?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, sir. I don't know that. But I know that it - I would assume that it was fired at the shooting range, but I have no - I don't have any reason to believe it was done in close proximity to that time.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Few months go by - a couple months go by and you get confronted about your thefts from the law firm, correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: September of '21.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: And unlike June the 7th when Jeanne confronted you this time, they had unassailable evidence, correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's correct. I mean, they had ...

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: No wiggling out of this one, correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I didn't try to wiggle out of this one.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Well, you've been wiggling before, though, right? You wiggled when you stole your brother's money twice, correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I admit almost all of these things, Mr. Waters, but that's one of the things that I take dispute with.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Which one.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: What's one that I stole that money that you're referring to?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You're going to dispute that? Let's hear about that then. Tell me why you dispute cashing that check twice.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't dispute cashing that check twice. WATERS

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I'm - what I'll tell you ...

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: How many $120,000 checks do you receive?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I got that check and this is several months after - I mean, you can look at my finances and you can see how I was doing. I didn't balance the checkbook.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Mm-hm.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: But the fact of the matter is when I got that check, I asked about it and I was told mistakenly that it was for me that I had done - participated in that year end thing, which I did sometimes, not often but sometimes. Apparently a new chick got cashed. I cashed that check. Then a year later ...

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, where did you keep that one for you?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't know where it was. It's obviously in my desk. But Mr. Waters ...

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: So you found it in your desk ...

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, I didn't find it.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Well, you say it was obviously in your desk, so you remember that - you remember finding it in your desk?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, I remember when we ...

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Did you go to finance and say I just found this year old check, is this right?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: No, you took it to the back, didn't you?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, sir.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Objection, Your Honor.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I didn't ...

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: (Inaudible) not allowing Mr. Murdaugh to answer the question.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Keep going.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: And that was a year after.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Okay.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: But I do dispute that I stole that money. That money.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Well, I mean you brought it up so any other money you dispute stealing?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No. No, sir, you brought it up. I was just telling you that that was the one I disputed.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. And you heard Ronnie Crosby and Mark Ball testified about that, correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I heard Ronnie and Mark testify about what they thought about it, yes sir.

utterances.speaker: BIANNA GOLODRYGA, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: We're going to take you back to the courtroom in Walterboro, South Carolina for the testimony of Alex Murdaugh.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: And the that you told of an unknown assailant was to try to make people think that the "real guy," bad guys, we're back again to finish the job, isn't that true?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, sir, that's not true.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: That's not the effect that you intended that story to have? Did it have that effect on people that you knew?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't ...

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: ... isn't that the effect that it had?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't think there's many people that believe that. No, sir. I know the people that were - I mean, the people that were closest to me didn't believe that, so no sir.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: When accountability is at your door, Mr. Murdaugh, bad things happened, don't - isn't that true? MURDAUGH

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: (Inaudible) go ahead ...

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: ... bad things happen. What do you mean by bad things?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: June 7th happened. September 4th happened.
